verses.kjv: Woe be unto the pastors that destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture! saith the LORD.
verses.web: “Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture!” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Disaster is coming for the leaders who destroy and scatter the flock I've been caring for!" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD God of Israel against the pastors that feed my people; Ye have scattered my flock, and driven them away, and have not visited them: behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Therefore LORD, the God of Israel, says against the shepherds who feed my people: “You have scattered my flock, driven them away, and have not visited them. Behold, I will visit on you the evil of your doings,” says LORD.
verses.ct: So the LORD, the God of Israel, says this to the leaders responsible for his people: "You have scattered my flock, driven them away, and refused to look after them. Now watch — I'm going to punish you for the evil things you've done," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they shall be fruitful and increase.
verses.web: “I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all the countries where I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds; and they will be fruitful and multiply.
verses.ct: "I myself will gather what's left of my flock from every country where I've driven them. I'll bring them back to their homeland, and they'll be fruitful and grow in number.

verses.kjv: And I will set up shepherds over them which shall feed them: and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall they be lacking, saith the LORD.
verses.web: I will set up shepherds over them, who will feed them. They will no longer be afraid or dismayed, neither will any be lacking,” says LORD.
verses.ct: I'll put new shepherds over them who will truly care for them. They won't be afraid or terrified anymore, and not a single one will be missing," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch, and a King shall reign and prosper, and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.
verses.web: “Behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that I will raise to David a righteous Branch, and he will reign as king and deal wisely, and will execute justice and righteousness in the land.
verses.ct: "The days are coming," declares the LORD, "when I will raise up a righteous Branch from David's line. He will reign as king with wisdom and carry out justice and righteousness throughout the land.

verses.kjv: In his days Judah shall be saved, and Israel shall dwell safely: and this is his name whereby he shall be called, THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.
verses.web: In his days Judah will be saved, and Israel will dwell safely. This is his name by which he will be called: LORD our righteousness.
verses.ct: During his reign, Judah will be rescued and Israel will live in safety. This is the name he will be known by: THE LORD OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS."

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that they shall no more say, The LORD liveth, which brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
verses.web: “Therefore behold, the days come,” says LORD, “that they will no more say, ‘As LORD lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;’
verses.ct: "So the days are coming," declares the LORD, "when people will no longer say, 'As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the people of Israel out of Egypt.'

verses.kjv: But, The LORD liveth, which brought up and which led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all countries whither I had driven them; and they shall dwell in their own land.
verses.web: but, ‘As LORD lives, who brought up and who led the offspring of the house of Israel out of the north country, and from all the countries where I had driven them.’ Then they will dwell in their own land.”
verses.ct: Instead they'll say, 'As surely as the LORD lives, who brought the descendants of Israel back from the northern lands and from every country where he had scattered them.' Then they'll live in their own land again."

verses.kjv: Mine heart within me is broken because of the prophets; all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine hath overcome, because of the LORD, and because of the words of his holiness.
verses.web: Concerning the prophets: My heart within me is broken. All my bones shake. I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine has overcome, because of LORD, and because of his holy words.
verses.ct: About the prophets — my heart is shattered inside me. Every bone in my body trembles. I stagger like a drunk, like someone overpowered by wine, because of the LORD and because of his holy words.

verses.kjv: For the land is full of adulterers; for because of swearing the land mourneth; the pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up, and their course is evil, and their force is not right.
verses.web: For the land is full of adulterers; for because of the curse the land mourns. The pastures of the wilderness have dried up. Their course is evil, and their might is not right;
verses.ct: The land is full of people committing adultery. Because of God's curse, the land mourns and the pastures in the wilderness have dried up. These people chase after evil, and they use their power for wrong.

verses.kjv: For both prophet and priest are profane; yea, in my house have I found their wickedness, saith the LORD.
verses.web: for both prophet and priest are profane. Yes, in my house I have found their wickedness,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "Both prophet and priest are corrupt. I've even found their wickedness right here in my own temple," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery ways in the darkness: they shall be driven on, and fall therein: for I will bring evil upon them, even the year of their visitation, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Therefore their way will be to them as slippery places in the darkness. They will be driven on, and fall therein; for I will bring evil on them, even the year of their visitation,” says LORD.
verses.ct: "So their path will become slippery ground in the dark. They'll be shoved forward and fall flat. I'm going to bring disaster on them when the time comes for their punishment," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria; they prophesied in Baal, and caused my people Israel to err.
verses.web: “I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria. They prophesied by Baal, and caused my people Israel to err.
verses.ct: "Among the prophets of Samaria I saw something disgusting — they prophesied in Baal's name and led my people Israel astray.

verses.kjv: I have seen also in the prophets of Jerusalem an horrible thing: they commit adultery, and walk in lies: they strengthen also the hands of evildoers, that none doth return from his wickedness: they are all of them unto me as Sodom, and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.
verses.web: In the prophets of Jerusalem I have also seen a horrible thing: they commit adultery and walk in lies. They strengthen the hands of evildoers, so that no one returns from his wickedness. They have all become to me as Sodom, and its inhabitants as Gomorrah.”
verses.ct: But among the prophets of Jerusalem I've seen something even more horrifying: they commit adultery and live by lies. They encourage evildoers so that no one turns away from their wickedness. To me, they've all become like Sodom, and the people of Jerusalem like Gomorrah."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts concerning the prophets; Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink the water of gall: for from the prophets of Jerusalem is profaneness gone forth into all the land.
verses.web: Therefore LORD of Armies says concerning the prophets: “Behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink poisoned water; for from the prophets of Jerusalem ungodliness has gone out into all the land.”
verses.ct: So the LORD of Armies says this about those prophets: "Watch — I'm going to feed them wormwood and make them drink poisoned water, because the prophets of Jerusalem have spread corruption throughout the entire land."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they make you vain: they speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of the LORD.
verses.web: LORD of Armies says, “Don’t listen to the words of the prophets who prophesy to you. They teach you vanity. They speak a vision of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD of Armies says: "Don't listen to what these prophets are telling you. They're filling you with empty hopes. They speak visions from their own imagination, not from the mouth of the LORD.

verses.kjv: They say still unto them that despise me, The LORD hath said, Ye shall have peace; and they say unto every one that walketh after the imagination of his own heart, No evil shall come upon you.
verses.web: They say continually to those who despise me, ‘LORD has said, “You will have peace;” ’ and to everyone who walks in the stubbornness of his own heart they say, ‘No evil will come on you.’
verses.ct: They keep telling people who despise me, 'The LORD says you'll have peace.' And to everyone who stubbornly follows their own desires, they say, 'Nothing bad will happen to you.'

verses.kjv: For who hath stood in the counsel of the LORD, and hath perceived and heard his word? who hath marked his word, and heard it?
verses.web: For who has stood in the council of LORD, that he should perceive and hear his word? Who has listened to my word, and heard it?
verses.ct: But which of them has ever stood in the LORD's council to see and hear his word? Which of them has actually paid attention to his word and listened?

verses.kjv: Behold, a whirlwind of the LORD is gone forth in fury, even a grievous whirlwind: it shall fall grievously upon the head of the wicked.
verses.web: Behold, LORD’s storm, his wrath, has gone out. Yes, a whirling storm: It will burst on the head of the wicked.
verses.ct: Look — the LORD's storm has been unleashed in fury! A raging whirlwind will crash down on the heads of the wicked.

verses.kjv: The anger of the LORD shall not return, until he have executed, and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart: in the latter days ye shall consider it perfectly.
verses.web: LORD’s anger will not return until he has executed, and until he has performed the intents of his heart. In the latter days, you will understand it perfectly.
verses.ct: The LORD's anger won't turn back until he has fully carried out every intention of his heart. In the days to come, you'll understand this completely.

verses.kjv: I have not sent these prophets, yet they ran: I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied.
verses.web: I didn’t send these prophets, yet they ran. I didn’t speak to them, yet they prophesied.
verses.ct: I never sent these prophets, yet they ran with their messages. I never spoke to them, yet they prophesied anyway.

verses.kjv: But if they had stood in my counsel, and had caused my people to hear my words, then they should have turned them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.
verses.web: But if they had stood in my council, then they would have caused my people to hear my words, and would have turned them from their evil way, and from the evil of their doings.
verses.ct: If they had truly stood in my council, they would have proclaimed my words to my people and turned them from their evil ways and wicked actions."

verses.kjv: Am I a God at hand, saith the LORD, and not a God afar off?
verses.web: “Am I a God at hand,” says LORD, “and not a God afar off?
verses.ct: "Am I only a God who is nearby," declares the LORD, "and not a God who is far away as well?

verses.kjv: Can any hide himself in secret places that I shall not see him? saith the LORD. Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith the LORD.
verses.web: Can anyone hide himself in secret places so that I can’t see him?” says LORD. “Don’t I fill heaven and earth?” says LORD.
verses.ct: Can anyone hide in some secret place where I can't see them?" declares the LORD. "Don't I fill all of heaven and earth?" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I have heard what the prophets said, that prophesy lies in my name, saying, I have dreamed, I have dreamed.
verses.web: “I have heard what the prophets have said, who prophesy lies in my name, saying, ‘I had a dream! I had a dream!’
verses.ct: "I've heard what these prophets are saying — the ones who prophesy lies in my name, claiming, 'I had a dream! I had a dream!'

verses.kjv: How long shall this be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies? yea, they are prophets of the deceit of their own heart;
verses.web: How long will this be in the heart of the prophets who prophesy lies, even the prophets of the deceit of their own heart?
verses.ct: How long will this go on? How long will these prophets keep pushing the lies that come from their own deceiving hearts?

verses.kjv: Which think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbour, as their fathers have forgotten my name for Baal.
verses.web: They intend to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they each tell his neighbor, as their fathers forgot my name because of Baal.
verses.ct: They think their dreams, which they eagerly share with each other, will make my people forget my name — just like their ancestors forgot my name because of Baal.

verses.kjv: The prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the chaff to the wheat? saith the LORD.
verses.web: The prophet who has a dream, let him tell a dream; and he who has my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the straw to the wheat?” says LORD.
verses.ct: Let the prophet who has a dream go ahead and tell his dream. But the one who has my word must speak my word faithfully. What does straw have in common with wheat?" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Is not my word like as a fire? saith the LORD; and like a hammer that breaketh the rock in pieces?
verses.web: “Isn’t my word like fire?” says LORD; “and like a hammer that breaks the rock in pieces?
verses.ct: "Isn't my word like fire?" declares the LORD. "Isn't it like a hammer that shatters rock into pieces?

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, saith the LORD, that steal my words every one from his neighbour.
verses.web: “Therefore behold, I am against the prophets,” says LORD, “who each steal my words from his neighbor.
verses.ct: "So pay attention — I am against these prophets," declares the LORD, "who steal my words from one another.

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against the prophets, saith the LORD, that use their tongues, and say, He saith.
verses.web: Behold, I am against the prophets,” says LORD, “who use their tongues, and say, ‘He says.’
verses.ct: I am against these prophets," declares the LORD, "who wag their own tongues and then announce, 'The LORD declares.'

verses.kjv: Behold, I am against them that prophesy false dreams, saith the LORD, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their lightness; yet I sent them not, nor commanded them: therefore they shall not profit this people at all, saith the LORD.
verses.web: Behold, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams,” says LORD, “who tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their vain boasting; yet I didn’t send them or command them. They don’t profit this people at all,” says LORD.
verses.ct: I am against those who prophesy false dreams," declares the LORD. "They tell them and lead my people astray with their lies and reckless boasting. I never sent them or gave them any orders. They do this people absolutely no good," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And when this people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask thee, saying, What is the burden of the LORD? thou shalt then say unto them, What burden? I will even forsake you, saith the LORD.
verses.web: “When this people, or the prophet, or a priest, asks you, saying, ‘What is the message from LORD?’ Then you shall tell them, ‘ “What message? I will cast you off,” says LORD.’
verses.ct: "When anyone from this people — or a prophet or a priest — asks you, 'What message does the LORD have?' you are to tell them, 'What message? I'm going to cast you off,' declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And as for the prophet, and the priest, and the people, that shall say, The burden of the LORD, I will even punish that man and his house.
verses.web: As for the prophet, the priest, and the people, who say, ‘The message from LORD,’ I will even punish that man and his household.
verses.ct: As for any prophet, priest, or ordinary person who says, 'I have a message from the LORD,' I will punish that person and their entire household.

verses.kjv: Thus shall ye say every one to his neighbour, and every one to his brother, What hath the LORD answered? and, What hath the LORD spoken?
verses.web: You will say everyone to his neighbor, and everyone to his brother, ‘What has LORD answered?’ and, ‘What has LORD said?’
verses.ct: Instead, this is what you should ask each other: 'What has the LORD answered?' and 'What has the LORD said?'

verses.kjv: And the burden of the LORD shall ye mention no more: for every man’s word shall be his burden; for ye have perverted the words of the living God, of the LORD of hosts our God.
verses.web: You will mention the message from LORD no more: for every man’s own word has become his message; for you have perverted the words of the living God, of LORD of Armies, our God.
verses.ct: But stop claiming to have 'a message from the LORD,' because each person's own words have become their so-called message. You have twisted the words of the living God, the LORD of Armies, our God.

verses.kjv: Thus shalt thou say to the prophet, What hath the LORD answered thee? and, What hath the LORD spoken?
verses.web: You will say to the prophet, ‘What has LORD answered you?’ and, ‘What has LORD spoken?’
verses.ct: This is how you should speak to a prophet: 'What has the LORD answered you?' and 'What has the LORD said?'

verses.kjv: But since ye say, The burden of the LORD; therefore thus saith the LORD; Because ye say this word, The burden of the LORD, and I have sent unto you, saying, Ye shall not say, The burden of the LORD;
verses.web: Although you say, ‘The message from LORD;’ therefore LORD says: ‘Because you say this word, “The message from LORD,” and I have sent to you, telling you not to say, “The message from LORD;”
verses.ct: But if you keep saying, 'This is a message from the LORD' — then the LORD says this: Because you keep using the phrase 'a message from the LORD' even though I sent word telling you to stop saying it,

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you, and I will forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers, and cast you out of my presence:
verses.web: therefore, behold, I will utterly forget you, and I will cast you off, and the city that I gave to you and to your fathers, away from my presence.
verses.ct: I myself will completely forget you. I will throw you away — you and the city I gave to you and your ancestors — right out of my presence.

verses.kjv: And I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame, which shall not be forgotten.
verses.web: I will bring an everlasting reproach on you, and a perpetual shame, which will not be forgotten.’ ”
verses.ct: I will bring everlasting disgrace on you and permanent shame that will never be forgotten."
